context: The word 'toonud' is the past participle form of the Estonian verb 'tulema' (to come) in the positive perfective aspect. It indicates that an action of bringing something has been completed in the past and relates to the present moment. In English, it corresponds to 'brought' or 'has brought'. This form is typically used with auxiliary verbs like 'on' (is/has) or 'olen' (am/have).
